se.vingmedia.xss.server
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--se.vingmedia.xss.server.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientEventListener, java.lang.Runnable

This is the class containing the "main" method, and is responsible for accepting and allocating incoming connections as well as garbage-collecting old ClientProxies and idle clients.

Constructor Detail

Server

public Server()

Server

public Server(java.lang.String configfile)
Here's the real forge where the hard work is done. After the initial bootstrapping and configuration, it is mainly a loop hanging on a blocking accept(), and distributing incoming connections to new threads and available ClientProxy objects, or creates new if none (unless the ProxiesPerServer treshold has been reached).
Method Detail

getVersionString

public static java.lang.String getVersionString()
Returns a version string in the format "major.minor"

getGUID

public static int getGUID()
This function returns globally unique ID's for the server, used for the ClientConnection ID's.

broadcast

public void broadcast(ClientConnection source,
                      java.lang.String msg,
                      boolean override)
Broadcast message "msg" originating from "source" to _all_ clients. If "override" is true, all clients will receive the message, regardless of the connections' "receiveBroadcasts" property. If the server is heavily loaded, use this method with care.

run

public void run()
This is the garbace collector thread (which also serves the optional status messages). Every GCInterval (configuration value) seconds, the garbage collector is run. The garbage collector is responsible for dereferencing any ClientProxy object without clients, and closing connections which have been idle for too long (configuration option "ClientIdleTimeout").
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

public static long getUptime()
Returns the uptime of the server in milliseconds

clientStop

public void clientStop(ClientConnection c)
Description copied from interface: ClientEventListener
Inform the listener that the client associated with the ClientConnection client has been removed from the ClientProxy, for any reason.

clientDebug

public static void clientDebug(ClientConnection c,
                               java.lang.String s)
Used to debug client communication. Prints out client information (ClientConnection.toString()) along with a timestamp and the supplied String to stdout.

fatal

public static void fatal(java.lang.String s)
This method should be called when an unrecoverable error has been encountered and execution cannot (or should not) continue. An error message will me printed on stderr and the JVM will exit.

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argc)
